p: Teenage suicides have risen in Taiwan at an alarming rate. As shown in Figure 1, the number of suicide deaths among adolescents under the age of 14 years has increased from 2 to 10 per year between 2014 and 2019, and for adolescents between the ages of 15 and 24 years it increased from 161 to 257 during the same period ( 4). The suicide death rate of adolescents in 2019 reached a 10-year high. The common causes for teenage suicides in Taiwan were “a lack of meaning or value of life” and “to escape from or avoid pain” ( 5, 6).
